get.summary:
Gets all users defined in the system user limit=x&offset=n to paginate
To include email,access and roles, use following parameters
&includeEmailAddresses=true&includeUserAccess=true&includeRoles=true

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit reponse to x rows. Default: 100

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset reponse rows

parameters.name: includeEmailAddresses
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude user email addresses

parameters.name: includeUserAccess
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude user access information

parameters.name: includeRoles
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude roles assigned to user

204.description: No content, if no users are registered

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

post.summary: Create a new WebsakUser from JSON object provided.Returns JSON object representing created user.
post.description:
Creates a Websak user based on the JSON data provided in the request.

ExternalDepartmentID – External department id, this value will be matched against misc1 for lookup value. 

DepartmentCode - Department code => value will be matched against Department unit code. ExternalDepartmentID is then disregarded.
TilgangsOppsettID – ID for template for the user being created, the user gets access and roles based on this template. 

LookupField - Name of field that is used to lookup existing user. Possible values: Id (default) and Code.

Parameters: JSON Data object Acos.Websak.UserAPI.Core.Models.UserRequest

201.description: Created json object with new/updated user, and the GET url to user api/user/{newId}.

200.description: Object with updated user, and the GET url to user api/user/{newId}.

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

get.summary: Returns a list of websak users changed after supplied date

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Returns users changed after this date, format YYYY-MM-DD

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

get.summary: Returns a single websak user
get.description:
Gets one singe user.

Parameter {id}: Value can be of gid id or username.

Return values: One JSON object containing data for requested user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User AD string identifier or login id

parameters.name: lookupField
parameters.description: default=Id, Possible values: Id (default) and Code.

parameters.name: includeEmailAddresses
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude user email addresses

parameters.name: includeUserAccess
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude user access information

parameters.name: includeRoles
parameters.description: bool to include or exclude roles assigned to user

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

put.summary:
Updates websak user with data from JSON object provided.

All values from JSON object updates stored object.
put.description: Updates user based on values in JSON object in request. Values in the request will be mapped to Websak user. Values not included in JSON will be translated either to "" (empty string) or [null]. Side effect: Not included properties will cause data to be deleted/overwritten. Include all data always. If external department and/or access is changed, then current access are reset to new access profile. Return values : 200 OK - User Created/Updated. 404 - Unknown user 500 - Error message contains more details

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

get.summary: Deactivate websak user by setting expiration date to yesterday
get.description:
Activates or deactivates a user

User will be deactivated immedately by setting profile date to yesterday.

Parameter {id} : Username Return values : http response OK/NotFound with status message, or internalserver error + exception

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User AD string identifier

parameters.name: lookupField
parameters.description: Lookup field. Field to use when finding user. Possible values: Id (default), gidid and Code.

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

get.summary: Activates websak user by setting expiration date to [null]
get.description:
Activates a user.

User is immedately activated by removing expiration date from profile.

Parametere {id} : ADBrukernavn Return values : http response OK/NotFound with status message, or internalserver error + exception

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User AD string identifier

parameters.name: lookupField
parameters.description: Lookup field. Field to use when finding user. Possible values: Id (default), gidid and Code.

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

get.summary: Add user to provided access group.
get.description:
Adds the user to provided access group. Access group id must already be defined in system.

Parameter {id} – ADBrukernavn 

Parameter {accessGroupId} – Websak access group ID 

QueryParameter {lookupField} – Lookup field. Field to use when finding user. Possible values: Id (default), gidid and Code.

    If user is found by lookupField, then id is replaced with internal id . 

Return values : 200 OK, 500 + error message.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User AD string identifier

parameters.name: accessGroupId
parameters.description: Access group id

parameters.name: lookupField
parameters.description: Lookup field. Field to use when finding user. Possible values: Id (default), gidid and Code.

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid access token

403.description: Forbidden - Provided access token does not permit usage of this API or data

domain.description: User domain for login => used for 8.x versions

provider.description: Used to set provider for login details.

isPrimary.description:
defines if users login detail is primary
Defaults to true if not set.

departmentCode.description:
Assign user to department by using department code (SOA_AdmKort) 
Code will be used to find department in which new user is assigned.

lookupField.description: Use this to set lookup field in user

accessToZones.description:
Zones for User. set to null or empty to use default zone from db.
Available zones can be fetched from [get]://api/zones

emailAddr.description: This is obsolete - collected from emailaddr in gia.

id.description: Identifier for the role template (Gbr_GrmID); required.

departmentList.description: Comma separated list of department identifiers; required.

archiveList.description: Comma separated list of archive identifiers; optional.

journalUnitList.description: Comma separated list of journal unit identifiers; optional.

gradeList.description: Comma separated list of grade identifiers; required.

Acos.Websak.UserAPI.Core.Models.UserRole.description: Payload for adding or updating a user role assignment.
